Assume a game in which one rolls 20, 8-sided die, for a total number of 8^20 possible outcomes.
To calculate the probability of a particular event occurring, we divide the number of ways that event can occur by 8^20.
One can calculate the number of ways to get exactly 5 dice of the value 3.
(20 choose 5) gives us the number of orders of 3.
7^15 gives us the number of ways we can not get the value 3 for 15 rolls.
